intro: Microstylis heliophoba, commonly known as the sun-shy sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a small perennial herb that typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and swamps. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in spikelets. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and a preference for full sun to partial shade. Microstylis heliophoba is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
